CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [21][22][23][24][25] On the other hand , fused heteroarenes have been utilized as electron - donating units for the synthesis of DPP - based conjugated polymers. The incorporation of an extended fused aromatic unit in the polymer backbone is expected to induce strong intermolecular interactions ( π-π stacking ) , affording high crystallinity to the polymer and thus resulting in a reduced energy barrier for charge carrier transport. Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device. [26][27][28][29] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required. One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power. When a benzene or naphthalene group which has a weak electrondonating nature was incorporated into DPP - based copolymers , a low - lying HOMO energy level was achieved without a large sacrifice of the band - gap , and as a result PCEs were improved with enhanced V OC s as compared to the counterpart polymer with a strong electron - donating unit. 30,31 Anthracene is also an interesting building block as an electron - donating unit for low band - gap conjugated polymers , because the electron - donating power of anthracene is relatively weaker than fused heteroarenes such as thieno [3,2-b]thiophene and dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene , and therefore , anthracene - based copolymers are expected to have a low - lying HOMO energy level. Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit. Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC . Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3% . 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively. Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells. 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2-D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP |
| fused heteroarenes |
| thieno[3,2-b]thiophene |
| dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene |
| anthracene |
| 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene (TA) |
| benzene |
| naphthalene |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP |
| anthracene |
| 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene (TA) |
| thieno[3,2-b]thiophene |
| dithieno[3,2-b:2′,3′-d]thiophene |

I removed "fused heteroarenes" and "benzene" since they are not specific material names, but rather a class of materials. "Naphthalene" was also removed since it is not mentioned in the paragraph.

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: [21][22][23][24][25] On the other hand , fused heteroarenes have been utilized as electron - donating units for the synthesis of DPP - based conjugated polymers. Therefore , the DPP - based copolymers combined with fused heteroarenes have shown low band - gaps with excellent charge transport characteristics and thus a high short circuit current density ( J SC ) of the solar cell device. [26][27][28][29] However , since low band - gap DPP - based copolymers usually exhibit a relatively high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level , leading to a low open circuit voltage ( V OC ) of PSCs , a compromise between the band - gap and the HOMO energy level of DPP - based polymers is critically required. One way to solve the trade - off between V OC and J SC of the PSC based on low band - gap polymers is to introduce arene groups which have weak electron - donating power. Furthermore , anthracene - based copolymers usually exhibit high crystallinity and high charge carrier mobility due to the coplanar fused structure of the anthracene unit. Therefore , a combination of DPP and anthracene could be ideal , thus leading to high J SC and V OC . Nevertheless , a few studies have reported that anthracene - DPP conjugated polymers show low PCEs less than 3% . 32 Here , we synthesized low band - gap copolymers incorporating 9,10-bis (5-(2-ethylhexyl)thiophen-2-yl)anthracene ( TA ) and DPP as an electron - donating and electron - withdrawing unit , respectively. Very recently , we have successfully demonstrated that TA is a promising electron - donating moiety of medium band - gap conjugated copolymers for high performance polymer solar cells. 33 In conjunction with its weak electrondonating characteristics , TA possesses an extended conjugation in 2-D , which is expected to enhance the light absorption and self - assembly of the resulting copolymer.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |
| Band-gap |
| π-π stacking |
| Crystallinity |
| Charge carrier mobility |
| Short circuit current density (JSC) |
| Open circuit voltage (VOC) |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |

Note: These property names are mentioned in the given paragraph, and they are all relevant to the field of organic electronics and polymer solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |
| Band-gap |
| π-π stacking |

The following entities do not clearly refer to property names of materials and were removed:

* Crystallinity
* Charge carrier mobility
* Short circuit current density (JSC)
* Open circuit voltage (VOC)
* Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| HOMO energy level | Relatively high |
| Band-gap | Low |
| J SC (short circuit current density) | High |
| V OC (open circuit voltage) | Low |
| PCEs (power conversion efficiency) | Improved |

| Charge carrier mobility | High |
| Light absorption | Enhanced |
